Package tage.networking.client

Class UDPClientSocket

java.lang.Object
java.net.DatagramSocket
tage.networking.client.UDPClientSocket
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable, IClientSocket
public class UDPClientSocket extends DatagramSocket implements IClientSocket
A client socket for sending and receiving packets using the UDP protocol. This socket is able to send and receive Serializable objects from client side of a game. The underlying DatagramSocket is used in this implementation.
Author:
Kyle Matz Modified from the SAGE Networking package for the RAGE game engine by Juan E. Ruiz. Ported to TAGE by Scott Gordon.
See Also:
  • DatagramSocket

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    UDPClientSocket()
    Creates an unconnected socket.
    UDPClientSocket(InetAddress remoteAddr, int remotePort)
    Constructs a socket connected to the remote address and remote port specified.
    UDPClientSocket(InetAddress remoteAddr, int remotePort, int localPort)
    Constructs a socket bound to the local port and connected to the remote address and remote port.
    UDPClientSocket(InetAddress remoteAddr, int remotePort, InetAddress localAddr, int localPort)
    Constructs a socket bound to the local port and address and connected to the remote address and remote port.

  • Constructor Details

    • UDPClientSocket

      public UDPClientSocket() throws IOException
      Creates an unconnected socket. This socket should be connected via connectTo(InetAddress, int) before being used. See DatagramSocket() for local binding information.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • UDPClientSocket

      public UDPClientSocket(InetAddress remoteAddr, int remotePort) throws IOException
      Constructs a socket connected to the remote address and remote port specified. Connected should be true upon returning from this method. See DatagramSocket() for local binding information.
      Parameters:
      remoteAddr - remote address to connect to.
      remotePort - remote port to connect to.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • UDPClientSocket

      public UDPClientSocket(InetAddress remoteAddr, int remotePort, int localPort) throws IOException
      Constructs a socket bound to the local port and connected to the remote address and remote port. Connected should be true upon returning from this method. See DatagramSocket(int) for local binding information.
      Parameters:
      remoteAddr - remote address to connect to.
      remotePort - remote port to connect to.
      localPort - local port to bind to.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • UDPClientSocket

      public UDPClientSocket(InetAddress remoteAddr, int remotePort, InetAddress localAddr, int localPort) throws IOException
      Constructs a socket bound to the local port and address and connected to the remote address and remote port. Connected should be true upon returning from this method. See DatagramSocket(int, InetAddress) for local binding information.
      Parameters:
      remoteAddr - remote address to connect to.
      remotePort - remote port to connect to.
      localAddr - local address to bind to.
      localPort - local port to bind to.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • connectTo

      public void connectTo(InetAddress remoteAddress, int remotePort) throws IOException
      Connects the client socket to the specified InetAddress and port. The client socket should be connected before being used. Connected should be true upon returning from this method.
